title: Draper completes initial milestones for NASA CLPS mission
summary: Draper has completed the first milestones of a NASA award to perform the first commercial landing on the far side of the moon in 2025.

title: NASA's Curiosity Mars Rover Gets a Major Software Upgrade
summary: The update brings loads of improvements, the most significant being new driving capabilities.

title: Investing in Space: Intelsat signs up for Northrop Grumman satellite servicing
summary: It may be time to service your satellite.

title: Space Systems Command’s Tetra-1 begins mission operations
summary: Millennium Space Systems announced the handoff April 13 of the Tetra-1 microsatellite to the U.S. Space Force Space Systems Command for the start of mission operations.

title: ESCAPADE confident in planned 2024 New Glenn launch
summary: The head of a NASA Mars mission flying on Blue Origin’s New Glenn rocket says he is confident the vehicle will be ready in time for a launch next year.

title: Kepler Communications raises $92 million for optical data relay network
summary: Canadian small satellite operator Kepler Communications said April 13 it has raised $92 million to start deploying an optical data-relay constellation next year.

title: Relativity shelves Terran 1 after one launch, redesigns Terran R
summary: Relativity Space has decided to retire its Terran 1 small launch vehicle after a single flight that failed to reach orbit, focusing its resources on a revised version of its larger Terran R rocket.

title: Amid commercial boom, U.S. military lacks timely access to satellite imagery
summary: The way in which commercial imagery is procured by the government does not necessarily support military commanders’ needs for timely intelligence, officials said at the Planet Explore 2023 conference.

title: Europe is about to launch one of its most ambitious missions ever
summary: "We wanted to see if these were possible habitats for life."

title: Inmarsat and MediaTek expand direct-to-device partnership
summary: Inmarsat and Taiwanese chipmaker MediaTek announced plans April 12 to jointly develop technologies needed to enable more mass market devices to connect directly to the British satellite operator’s network.
